column2: question
column5: I find it hard to know what is true and what is false about Coronavirus
column6: I am trying to avoid news about Coronavirus
column7: The mainstream media is exaggerating the seriousness of Coronavirus
column8: This crisis is showing some positive sides of society (e.g. more local/community spirit, support for NHS)
column9: I am confused about what I should be doing in response to Coronavirus
column10: I feel confident that I understand the statistics and data used to provide the number of Coronavirus cases and deaths in the UK
column11: I would agree to be vaccinated against the Coronavirus if there was a vaccine approved by the NHS available tomorrow
column12: On balance, I am comfortable that my child/ children is/are back at school
column13: I am happy to be vaccinated against the Coronavirus
column14: I follow international/ world news about Coronavirus
column15: On balance, I am happy that my child/ children is/are still able to go to school
column16: I am confident that I understand the different rules that apply in each tier
column17: I am confident that I understand the different rules that apply in each protection level
column18: I intend to form a 'Christmas bubble' between 23-27 December
column19: I am confident that I understand the rules around forming a 'Christmas bubble', including who can be part of the bubble and the extra travel dates for Northern Ireland
column20: I would be comfortable to be vaccinated against the Coronavirus if there was a vaccine approved by the NHS available tomorrow
